summary.para: Gets the for the sensor group.

param.name: ppAttributes
param.para: The interface representing the internal attribute store of the sensor device.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: The sensor device has not been initialized.

remarks.para: The object returned is a copy of the internal attribute store and so changes made to the returned attributes have no effect on the .

summary.para: Gets the unique identifier for the device. This value is currently unused.

param.name: pDeviceId
param.para: The unique identifier for the device.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: The sensor group has not been initialized.

summary.para: Gets a value that specifies the type of sensor device represented by the object.

param.name: pType
param.para: A value that specifies the type of sensor device represented by the object.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: The sensor group has not been initialized.

summary.para: Gets the flags set for the sensor device. This method is reserved for future use.

param.name: pFlags
param.para: The flags set for the sensor device.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: The sensor group has not been initialized.

remarks.para: This method is reserved for future use and should not be called.

summary.para: Gets a value that specifies the current sharing mode of the sensor device, which is either controller or shared.

param.name: peMode
param.para: If the call succeeds, receives a member of the , specifying the current mode of the sendsor device.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: The sensor group has not been initialized.

summary.para: Gets the stream attribute store with the specified index.

param.name: eType
param.para: A member of the enumeration specifying whether the attribute store is being requested for an input or output stream.

param.name: dwIndex
param.para: The 0-based index of the stream to be retrieved. The index must be between 0 and the value returned by - 1.

param.name: ppAttributes
param.para: The interface representing a copy internal attribute store of the stream.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: The sensor group has not been initialized.

remarks.para: The object returned is a copy of the internal attribute store and so changes made to the returned attributes have no effect on the .

summary.para: Gets the count of stream attribute stores for the sensor device. This number represents the number of total streams available for the device because every valid stream must have an attribute store that contains at least the stream ID and stream category.

param.name: eType
param.para: A member of the enumeration specifying whether the attribute store count is being requested for an input or output stream.

param.name: pdwCount
param.para: The number of stream attributes available for this sensor device.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: The sensor group has not been initialized.

remarks.para: The caller can use the number of stream attributes to indicate the number of streams provided by the sensor device.

Note Depending on the sharing mode in which the sensor device was activated, not all streams may be present during runtime. Streams marked as shared, i.e. with the MF_DEVICESTREAM_FRAMESERVER_SHARED attribute set to non-zero value, and streams with pins with the category PINNAME_VIDEO_PREVIEW will be present in devices that are set to used shared mode. Put a device in shared mode by passing into . If no streams are marked as shared and no preview stream is available, the first capture stream, with the category PINNAME_VIDEO_CAPTURE, will be shared.

summary.para: Gets the symbolic link name of the sensor device.

param.name: SymbolicLink
param.para: Buffer of cchSymbolicLink characters where the symbolic link name will be written. The buffer must be large enough to account for the null terminator.

param.name: cchSymbolicLink
param.para: Number of characters available in SymbolicLink buffer.

param.name: pcchWritten
param.para: Output parameter containing the number of characters written to SymbolicLink. This includes the null terminator. If SymbolicLink is null and cchSymbolicLink is 0, pcchWritten will contain the number of characters needed (including the null terminator) to store the symbolic link name.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: The buffer provided in the SymbolicLink parameter is not large enough to contain the symbolic link name, including the null terminator.
The sensor device has not been initialized.

remarks.para: Depending on the type of device, which is defined by a member of the enumeration and can be obtained by calling , the resulting symbolic name may be a valid device symbolic name or a provider URL. The caller should not attempt to parse the name and should treat it as opaque data.

summary.para: Sets a value that specifies the sharing mode of the sensor device to either controller or shared.

param.name: eMode
param.para: A member of the enumeration specifying whether the device is in shared or controller mode.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: The sensor group has not been initialized.

summary.para: Represents a sensor device that can belong to a sensor group, which is represented by the interface. The term "device" in this context could refer to a physical device, a custom media source, or a frame provider.
